intro: Hieracium sorianum, commonly known as the Sorian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium sorianum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can form dense colonies due to its rhizomatous growth habit.
